step.description: In the main toolbar, click the 'red circle' icon or Application Server icon and click Yes. The button will change to a 'green circle' icon, representing the Application Server.
Alternatively, click Tools > Application Server > Start Server.

section.description: To display the Application Server Control Panel, click Tools > Application Server. In the resulting dialog, make sure that you have properly configured the Application Server. For details, refer to Configuring and Running the Server.

The Server Status icon will change from red to green to show that the server is running. If you wish to stop or restart the server, you may use the Stop Server and Restart Server buttons. Note the Document Root setting. This is where you want to place the HTML pages that the Application Server will server up to client applications. You can now minimize the Application Server Control Panel to get it out of your way.

section.title: Starting the Application Server Automatically
section.description: The Application Server does not currently run as a Windows service. In order to have it start up automatically check the Automatically start the Application Server check box on the General tab of the Application Server Control Panel.
